intro: Eriogonum microtheca subsp. sarothriforme, commonly known as the Sierra sacaton, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, often branched inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
